review_title: NAIT is the family I always wished I'd had
job_title: Organizational Development Consultant in Edmonton, AB
pros: I'm no spring chicken, meaning that I have worked at a lot of different organizations. NAIT is the best place I ever worked. They care about their employees, almost to a fault (see cons). They treat employees like family. There is a palpable sense that employees care deeply about what NAIT offers to the community and beyond. Employees generally work very hard and are pointed in the same direction (instead of being self-serving and politicking to get ahead). Hard work and being a good person is rewarded. The environment is very supportive of doing good work. I honestly didn't ever think I could love an employer this much. The new CEO is much different in that she brings a strong business acumen. As hard as this is to adjust to, it's needed if NAIT is to successfully navigate these times and continue to vibrantly serve Alberta and beyond.
cons: NAIT treats people like family, which also means people can act badly for a long time (sometimes for a very long time) before being held accountable if they are ever held accountable. I want to believe this is beginning to change. On the whole, instructors care deeply about students and about providing excellent education, but I do wish that the union took a more collaborative stance and led more productive, wholesome relationships with the org. It's not unusual to have strife between union instuctors and a post-secondary institution, but it is unfortunate and does impact the culture.

-	They spend money begging industries for donations to refill their deficit using “donations”, meanwhile they penny pinch fining students for parking tickets and tuition fees. 
-	There is rampant Nepotism, favoritism with a spark of Racism all active in Hiring staff who are also incompetent. They have no clue what to look for when they hire and hope they got lucky. They also prioritize people who really need the paycheck over people who are more competent.

Its because they are busy trying to internally find a family or friend into that position, they wont even look at your CV/Resume. So don’t think you have anything lacking, they are just bad at hiring.
-	NAIT is a Pension accumulation center, best for people who are in their 45-50’s who cant get a job anywhere and have a huge mortgage, if you care about your skills and your career, do not come here.
-	There would be quite a few “filler” ratings on Glassdoor which are put here just to keep the rating high enough.
-	The senior management give themselves Bonuses meanwhile they freeze salaries of lower employees and call it even. 
-	They hide surveys from NAIT staff so that the reality of the institute does not get out, if people know what’s really happening they will all start leaving NAIT.
